basics.name: Quaid Bartolomei
basics.label: Full Stack Developer
basics.summary: Senior Full Stack Developer with deep expertise in React, TypeScript, and building scalable web and mobile applications. Proven leader in architecting solutions, optimizing developer workflows, and driving high-impact projects from backend to frontend.

work.summary: Digital business card platform for professionals and organizations to share contact info, manage connections, and integrate with CRMs. Offers web and mobile apps, advanced authentication, and AI-powered VOIP/SMS.
highlights: Key contributor in a fast-paced startup, deploying to production multiple times daily across web and mobile on a small engineering team.
Spearheaded the migration of a large JavaScript codebase to strict TypeScript, enhancing safety and maintainability across 600+ files.
Designed robust development workflows and CI/CD pipelines, ensuring long-term code health and rapid iteration.
Established E2E testing frameworks, significantly boosting product reliability and developer velocity.
Built and maintained cross-platform mobile features with Capacitor, including a fully featured VoIP calling plugin.
Automated mobile app releases using Fastlane, streamlining delivery to iOS and Android platforms.
Integrated OAuth and SSO solutions, including Google, Apple, and LinkedIn, to enhance security and onboarding flexibility.
Optimized frontend bundle size and performance, establishing CI tooling to prevent regressions and maintain high standards.
Migrated frontend architecture to Vite, reducing build times by 80% and improving developer experience.
Documented and streamlined local mobile development and E2E testing workflows for the team.
Mentored teammates and served as the go-to expert in React, CI/CD, and modern frontend tooling.
Drove continuous improvements in developer experience through automation and workflow enhancements.
Created a lightweight version of the app for release as an Apple App Clip by developing separate build scripts and implementing CI/CD checks to ensure the build size stayed within Apple's limits.

volunteer.summary: Open source organization that tracks global reforestation efforts on an individual scale with a map website and mobile reporting app and converts this work into a traceable, trackable token asset.
highlights: Improved project infrastructure by adding custom ESLint rules and introducing TypeScript for better code quality and maintainability.
Wrote E2E tests using Cypress to ensure reliability and catch regressions early.
Developed microservices for processing RabbitMQ events, enabling scalable asynchronous workflows.
Reviewed pull requests and collaborated with contributors in an open source environment.
